articles.title: Amazon's AWS outage on October 20 knocked services like Alexa, Snapchat, Fortnite, Venmo and more offline for hours
articles.description: It felt like half of the internet was dealing with a severe hangover on October 20. A severe Amazon Web Services outage took out many, many websites, apps, games and other services that rely on Amazon’s cloud division to stay up and running. That included a long list of popular software like Venmo,
articles.content: It felt like half of the internet was dealing with a severe hangover on October 20. A severe Amazon Web Services outage took out many, many websites, apps, games and other services that rely on Amazon’s cloud division to stay up and running. That included a long list of popular software like Venmo, Snapchat, Canva and Fortnite . Even Amazon's own assistant Alexa stuttered, and if you were wondering why the internet seemed to be against you — you weren't imagining it. The good news is that, Amazo
articles.author: Kris Holt

articles.title: Outage at Amazon Web Services disrupts websites across the internet
articles.description: Amazon's cloud computing service provides back-end support to many companies that operate online. When it has problems, so do they.

articles.description: Ryan welcomes John Dickerson, CEO of Mozilla.ai, to talk about the evolving landscape of AI agents, the role of open source in keeping the tech ecosystem healthy, the challenges OS communities have faced with the rise of AI, and the implications of data privacy and user choice in the age of multi-ag
articles.content: Ryan welcomes John Dickerson, CEO of Mozilla.ai, to talk about the evolving landscape of AI agents, the role of open source in keeping the tech ecosystem healthy, the challenges OS communities have faced with the rise of AI, and the implications of data privacy and user choice in the age of multi-agent AI systems.

articles.title: OpenAI is about to launch its new AI web browser, ChatGPT Atlas
articles.description: OpenAI has started teasing a livestream today for its rumored web browser. A mysterious teaser with a set of browser tabs appeared on OpenAI’s X account today, signaling that a livestream will reveal all at 1PM ET / 10AM PT today. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says the announcement is about “a new product I
articles.content: OpenAI has started teasing a livestream today for its rumored web browser. A mysterious teaser with a set of browser tabs appeared on OpenAI’s X account today, signaling that a livestream will reveal all at 1PM ET / 10AM PT today. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says the announcement is about “a new product I’m quite excited about!” The livestream link itself reveals that the browser is called ChatGPT Atlas and will be available globally on macOS today, with Windows, iOS, and Android versions coming
articles.author: Tom Warren

articles.title: The best Xbox controller to buy right now
articles.description: We live in a golden age of controllers. The gamepads on the market now are of higher quality, more versatile, and more customizable than anything from even one console generation ago. If you play games on an Xbox Series X or Series S (or a Windows PC), you have the unenviable task of choosing betwee
articles.content: We live in a golden age of controllers. The gamepads on the market now are of higher quality, more versatile, and more customizable than anything from even one console generation ago. If you play games on an Xbox Series X or Series S (or a Windows PC), you have the unenviable task of choosing between several high-quality controllers from Microsoft as well as a plethora of great options from the likes of 8BitDo, PowerA, Razer, Scuf, GameSir, Nacon, and Turtle Beach. Some of them have drift-resist
articles.author: Quentyn Kennemer

articles.title: Inside the breach that broke the internet: The untold story of Log4Shell
articles.description: Log4Shell proved that open source security isn't guaranteed and isn’t just a code problem. It's about supporting, enabling, and empowering the people behind the projects that build our digital infrastructure. The post Inside the breach that broke the internet: The untold story of Log4Shell appeared
articles.content: When Christian Grobmeier went to help his son with a Minecraft problem, he found the game displaying a warning: “We are suffering from a security hole from Log4J, please be careful and update immediately.” I stared at the screen and told my son, ‘I’m sorry, it’s my fault.’ Christian Grobmeier, Log4j maintainer This is the untold story of how one maintainer and the Log4j team navigated a crisis that exposed critical gaps in our digital infrastructure and demons
articles.author: Gregg Cochran

articles.title: There's another Kirby Air Riders Direct livestream on October 23 at 9AM ET
articles.description: Nintendo has another livestream planned for the upcoming Switch 2 exclusive Kirby Air Riders . This one takes place on October 23 at 9AM ET . That's less than a month before the game will be available for purchase . The company also says the stream will be a full hour, which is a heck of a long
articles.content: Nintendo has another livestream planned for the upcoming Switch 2 exclusive Kirby Air Riders . This one takes place on October 23 at 9AM ET . That's less than a month before the game will be available for purchase . The company also says the stream will be a full hour, which is a heck of a long time to spend on just one game a few weeks before launch. It's worth noting, however, that Kirby Air Riders is a Masahiro Sakurai title. Join us on Oct. 23 at 6 a.m. PT for a second #KirbyAirRider
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

articles.title: My Top Cursor Tips (Oct 2025)
articles.description: Why Cursor over Claude Code? Code-generation diffs are easier to review and roll back (the checkout system is great). You can test and use other models for different tasks ( o3 for complex tasks, gemini-2.5-pro for creativity, grok-code-fast-1 for quick tasks, etc.).* Good IDE integration (e.g., acc
articles.content: Why Cursor over Claude Code? Code-generation diffs are easier to review and roll back (the checkout system is great). You can test and use other models for different tasks ( o3 for complex tasks, gemini-2.5-pro for creativity, grok-code-fast-1 for quick tasks, etc.).* Good IDE integration (e.g., accept/reject actions work great across the UI). *That said, I’m only using claude-4.5-sonnet since its launch. How to 10x Productivity on Cursor Good pre-prompt Use .cursorrules or similar to enforce be
articles.author: Mark Kop

articles.title: Even Xbox developer kits are getting a big price hike
articles.description: After raising prices on Xbox consoles and subscriptions, Microsoft is now turning its attention to Xbox developers. Sources familiar with Microsoft's plans tell The Verge that the company is significantly increasing the price of its Xbox Development Kit (XDK) - the custom hardware used by developers
articles.content: After raising prices on Xbox consoles and subscriptions, Microsoft is now turning its attention to Xbox developers. Sources familiar with Microsoft's plans tell The Verge that the company is significantly increasing the price of its Xbox Development Kit (XDK) - the custom hardware used by developers to build Xbox games. The current Xbox dev kit is moving from $1,500 to $2,000, a 33 percent jump in price. "The adjustment reflects macroeconomic developments," says Microsoft in an announcement to X
articles.author: Tom Warren

articles.title: How to Build a Thread-Safe Rate Limiter with FastAPI and Atomic Redis
articles.description: Ever been worried about bots scraping your data, attackers brute-forcing logins, or your platform getting hit with a sudden spike in expensive operations? Without proper protection, a simple DDoS attack or bot script can cost you time, resources, and even thousands in third-party service fees (like
articles.content: Ever been worried about bots scraping your data, attackers brute-forcing logins, or your platform getting hit with a sudden spike in expensive operations? Without proper protection, a simple DDoS attack or bot script can cost you time, resources, and even thousands in third-party service fees (like SMS). Let me show you how to implement a thread-safe, high-performance rate limiter using Python, FastAPI, and Redis. The Concept Rate Limiting : Allow only X requests per Y seconds per user. For exam
articles.author: Aris Georgatos

articles.title: The astonishing embryo models of Jacob Hanna
articles.description: When the Palestinian stem-cell scientist Jacob Hanna was stopped while entering the US last May, airport customs agents took him aside and held him for hours in “secondary,” a back office where you don’t have your passport and can’t use your phone. There were two young Russian women and a candy mach
articles.content: When the Palestinian stem-cell scientist Jacob Hanna was stopped while entering the US last May, airport customs agents took him aside and held him for hours in “secondary,” a back office where you don’t have your passport and can’t use your phone. There were two young Russian women and a candy machine in the room with him. Hanna, who has a trim beard and glasses and holds an Israeli passport, accepted the scrutiny. “It’s almost like you are under arrest, but in a friendly way,” he says. He agre
articles.author: Antonio Regalado

articles.content: This is today’s edition of The Download , our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. The astonishing embryo models of Jacob Hanna Instead of relying on the same old recipe biology has followed for a billion years, give or take, stem-cell scientist Jacob Hanna is coaxing the beginnings of animal bodies directly from stem cells. Join these cells together in the right way, and they will spontaneously attempt to organize into an embry
articles.author: Rhiannon Williams

articles.title: How to update community health files with AI
articles.description: Have you ever thought about using AI to update community health files for your repositories? This blog shares actionable next steps for doing just that, including a starter kit with a checklist and tutorials on how to create three useful files. The post How to update community health files with AI a
articles.content: Maintaining your project’s community health files shouldn’t get in the way of writing code. GitHub Copilot can help you update and enhance your documentation, so you can stay focused on what really matters: working on the projects that excite you most. In this blog, we’ll touch on some of the most common community health files (focusing on README , contributor guides, and licenses) and why they’re so important for maintainers, along with actionable steps you can take to a
articles.author: Alexandra Lietzke

articles.content: General Motors has parked many unsold BrightDrop electric delivery vans on vacant lots in Flint and in Canada. | Image: Getty General Motors will end production of its Chevy Brightdrop electric vans at its factory in Ingersol, Ontario, the company said during its third quarter earnings call Tuesday. The decision was made as slow demand in the electric van market led to hundreds of Brightdrop vehicles piling up in dealer lots in both the US and Canada. GM CEO Mary Barra said the automaker would a

The company says it's the "thinnest e-paper frame available" that is "designed to join a gallery wall or stand alone." Aura isn't kidding here. This thing is just 0.6-inches thick. One of the primary pain points of traditional
articles.content: Aura just announced the Ink , a 13-inch color e-ink photo frame. The company says it's the "thinnest e-paper frame available" that is "designed to join a gallery wall or stand alone." Aura isn't kidding here. This thing is just 0.6-inches thick. One of the primary pain points of traditional digital photo frames is that many require constant power via an outlet. This creates an aesthetic problem, as one has to figure out a place to tuck away a power cord. Some modern frames operate via ba
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

articles.title: New noninvasive endometriosis tests are on the rise
articles.description: Shantana Hazel often thought her insides might fall out during menstruation. It took 14 years of stabbing pain before she ultimately received a diagnosis of endometriosis, an inflammatory disease where tissue similar to the uterine lining implants outside the uterus and bleeds with each cycle. The r
articles.content: Shantana Hazel often thought her insides might fall out during menstruation. It took 14 years of stabbing pain before she ultimately received a diagnosis of endometriosis, an inflammatory disease where tissue similar to the uterine lining implants outside the uterus and bleeds with each cycle. The results can include painful periods and damaging scar tissue. Hazel, now 50 and the founder of the endometriosis advocacy organization Sister Girl Foundation , was once told by a surgeon that her inter
articles.author: Colleen de Bellefonds

articles.title: It wasn’t space debris that struck a United Airlines plane—it was a weather balloon
articles.description: WindBorne says its balloons are compliant with all applicable airspace regulations.
articles.content: The mysterious impact of a United Airlines aircraft in flight last week has sparked plenty of theories as to its cause, from space debris to high-flying birds. However the question of what happened to flight 1093, and its severely damaged front window, appears to be answered in the form of a weather balloon. “I think this was a WindBorne balloon,” Kai Marshland, co-founder of the weather prediction company WindBorne Systems, told Ars in an email on Monday evening. “We learned about UA1093 and th
articles.author: Eric Berger

articles.title: NSO permanently barred from targeting WhatsApp users with Pegasus spyware
articles.description: Ruling holds that defeating end-to-end encryption in WhatsApp harms Meta's business.
articles.content: A federal judge has ordered spyware maker NSO to stop using its Pegasus app to target or infect users of WhatsApp. The ruling , issued Friday by Phyllis J. Hamilton of the US District Court of the District of Northern California, grants a permanent injunction sought by WhatsApp owner Meta in a case it brought against NSO in 2019 . The lawsuit alleged that Meta caught NSO trying to surreptitiously infect about 1,400 mobile phones—many belonging to attorneys, journalists, human-rights activists, p
articles.author: Dan Goodin

articles.title: Even with protections, wolves still fear humans
articles.description: European wolves flee human conversation faster than dogs' barking.
articles.content: Back in May 2025, the European Parliament changed the status of wolves in the EU from “strictly protected” to “protected,” which opened the way for its member states to allow hunting under certain conditions, such as protecting livestock. One of the arguments behind this change was that the “tolerance of modern society towards wolves” led to the emergence of “fearless wolves” that are no longer afraid of people. “Regulators made it clear though that there is no scientific evidence to back this u
articles.author: Jacek Krywko

articles.title: Big Tech may fall short of green energy targets due to proposed rule changes
articles.description: Goal is to create a "credible link" between companies and power they invest in.
articles.content: The world’s leading authority on carbon accounting has proposed stricter disclosure rules that are set to make it more challenging for large power users such as Amazon and Meta to hit their climate targets. The EU, California, and the International Financial Reporting Standards all draw on the voluntary Greenhouse Gas Protocol oversight body in their guidelines on how companies should disclose their carbon footprints. This week, the Protocol proposed the first update in a decade to how it measur
articles.author: Kenza Bryan, Financial Times
